Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I gotcha one. [Pam hands over a grape soda to Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh wow, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm just gonna grab some chips, you want some?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. Thanks... uh we're still having lunch today, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I guess. [Pam smiles and walks away, then comes back and kisses Jim on the cheek] How dare you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Toby. What's this? [holds up memo Toby has passed out to the staff]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Ohh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [reads memo] I just want to remind everyone about the company rules involving PDA or public displays of affection.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yes, uh some people in the office have complained...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh really.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: ...about some other people engaging in PDA and, you know [Michael leans in closer to Toby] I just wanted to remind it's not appropriate to, to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is this about me and Jan? In my office? Because I will have you know that that was consensual. What we did has nothing to do with you or anyone here. I don't think. I don't think anyone heard anything. We were very discreet and, and most people had left by that point. So I don't think it's any of your business. What I think you should do is roll up the memo, real tight...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Ok, look the memo is not about you...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [to everyone in the room] For the record, I have never been involved with anyone at work, in any capacity.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Alright everyone, look, it, alright my complaint was about Jim and Pam. So...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [turns to address Jim and Pam] No way.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You guys are together?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ummm... yup. Yes, we are.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Woooah! Wow!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Tuna!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Awesome!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I knew it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You guys! Yes! Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Toby, was this your fun little way of congratulating us?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh kay, mind is exploding. Get over here. [gestures to Pam to get up] Come on. Come here. Okay, okay, [to Jim] stand up. [Jim moves over in chair] OK, here we go. [holding both Pam and Jim's hand] Everyone, this is a day that will live in infamy. Because today, is the day that Jim and Pam become one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Actually, we've been dating for a couple months.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love you guys, so much. [hugs Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ohh.. [Michael goes to hug Pam, phone rings]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Phone's ringing. [goes back toward desk]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no Pam let 'em ring. Let the bells of Dunder Mifflin chime out your love. Because this is [starts to well up] really good, this is really good. My heart soars with the eagles nest.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't see it. I think they both could do better.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's not a surprise to me. Pam is the office mattress.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Jim Halpert's off the market. Guess who just became the best looking single guy in the office?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey. Can you make that straighter? That's what she said.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Did you plan it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. [tries to hide piece of paper, but Pam grabs it]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [reading from paper] Can you make that straighter? That job looks hard. You should put your mouth on that. How can you even use that one naturally?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Blowing up balloons I thought.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You might want to trim it a little.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael... [Kelly enters conference room in a flirty red dress]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [reading sign] Oh, is... Ryan coming back today?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, he is.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam and Jim are together. Ryan is visiting. Only thing that could make this day better is ice cream.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What do you want?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: To give you this [reveals a cat from under a coat].

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, what is that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a feral barn cat. I trapped him last night and I'm giving him to you as a replacement cat for the one I destroyed.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Her name was Sprinkles.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And his name is... Garbage. Mose calls him Garbage because he likes to eat garbage. [shakes cat] Don't you Garbage? [makes chomping noises]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I can't believe you just thought you could replace Sprinkles. Before she's even in the ground.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You haven't buried her yet?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Don't rush me. I'm grieving.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Garbage can be very helpful. OK, he's a youthful cat. He killed an entire family of raccoons. [holds cat towards Angela] Look at him.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't want Garbage! I want Sprinkles! [walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey... [sees both Jim and Pam] you two.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey. So now that we are dating, uh, we just wanted to know if we had to sign one of those 'we're dating' things for the company.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh well, you know, those were only for, you know [makes quotes with fingers] relationships, so... if, if this is just a casual thing, there's no need, really.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, I don't wanna speak for Jim, but, it's like pretty official. [Jim smiles]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sorry, uh do we need to sign one, or...?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Let's just wait and see what happens. [whispers] You know?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Let's just wait.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, OK.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great. [Jim and Pam walk away]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [sees Ryan coming through door] Hey Ryan. Welcome back --

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hold on one second. [Ryan types on Blackberry for a few seconds] Hey Pam! It's great to see you. Is Michael in?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There he is! There he is! He's back! And he's with a beard. [laughing] He... He has facial hair. Look at him! All grown up and no place to go. Hello, Mr. Sunny Crockett. I'm Tubs.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: OK. Should we get started?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohh, yeah, let's get started because uh, yes, cause uh this is very serious business and umm..

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yep, exactly. This is a business meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...business meeting --

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [rubbing hands in Ryan's hair] Fire!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Stop that! Stop that!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's right! That's right!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [to Kevin] You scared me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Fire guy. Don't start any fires, Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Fire guy [makes flames with his hands]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You weren't here for that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Here for what?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: When he started the fire.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look how big he is. Look at you, you are so mature and old and little man now. You're like our little man...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Little old man boy.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Michael and everybody, umm...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Beard.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Bearded man boy.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: ...let me just say something. I know I used to be a temp here, but now everything is different. I'd like your respect. I am your boss now. You're gonna have to treat me that same way you treated Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, wow!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: So...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's a little kinky. I don't swing that way.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: OK...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Woooo![laughs] I think Ryan has a gay crush on me.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Enough! OK? This is inappropriate and it stops right now. Do you understand?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, everybody, come on. Settle town. Let's get serious here. Um Ryan, has a very special, important presentation to do, which we will be doing in the conference room in [looks at Ryan] 10 minutes?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sounds good. OK, alright.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, Ryan snapped at me, but there was this twinkle in his eye that I picked up on, which said, "Dude, we're friends. I'm doing this for appearances. I am the big boss now. And I have to seem like an ogre. But you know me and you trust me. And we like each other. And we'll always be friends. And I would never take you for granted in a million years. And I miss you, man. And I love you." His words.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin Infinity represents a floor to ceiling streamlining of our business model. The center piece of the campaign is a new business-to-business website interface that will allow us to compete directly with big box chains.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait a second. Last time I checked, Dunder Mifflin already has a website. And quite frankly, I'm not really sure what's wrong with it. [Jim at his desk, showing the Dunder Mifflin website reading "Under Construction. Coming Christmas 2002!"]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: This is a massive overhaul. We're getting younger. Sleeker. And more agile so that we adapt to the market place. All essential personnel will be issued Blackberries for company use.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OOhh. Gimmme, gimme, gimme, gimme, gimme, gimme.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'll stick around to help you set them up afterwards. Any questions? Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What if we don't want to use a Blackberry because they are stupid and pointless?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: This is company-wide, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Got it. [Andy's hand goes up]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We should call it Dunder Mifflinfinity. You know, push the words together?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Any other questions? [Kelly's hand goes up] Kelly Kapoor.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Can we speak privately about our relationship?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Thank you everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ryan Howard everybody. [starts clapping] Good job. [everyone gets up to leave]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: That's some fun stuff. When does the website go up?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: As fast as possible. We want to start retraining people A.S.A.P., so we can hit the ground running with a new system.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Cool beans.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: We're screwed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who is?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Us? You and me. The old timers.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am not old. You are old. You are like a hundred.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: You're over 40, that's the cut off. Are you listening to what he's saying? Re-training. New system. Youth. I'm telling you this kid is the grim reaper. You deal with this or you, me, Sammy, Phyllis, the chick you hit with the car, we're goners.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Swore I wouldn't tell anyone this, but in the interest of revealing secrets. Oh my God, this will make your brain explode. Umm, Dwight and Angela dating. Have been for six months.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.. [in awe]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Swear to God. [Pam shakes her head]. Aww this is great. I was actually gonna wait and tell you on your birthday, but this is much more fun.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, they have been dating for like two years. [Jim in shock] Since before your barbeque.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait. What? [Pam nods her head] You knew? And you didn't say anything?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You didn't say anything to me?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Fair enough. Wow! We should have started dating like a long time ago.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Can you believe that...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Sorry, I didn't know you guys were in here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh no, we're just sitting here.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I couldn't see your hands. [Jim shakes his hands] Hey Pam, by the way, it's great that you're dating. But when a new client calls, you just have to randomly assign them to a sales person. You can't base who gets new clients on who you're sleeping with that week, OK?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And... that is why we waited so long to tell people.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: OK, what's up?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, kay. I was just... After the presentation, just wanted to make sure, that vis-a-vie, that everything in the office is business as usual?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well it is business, but not as usual.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know I understand... we're making great strides and we're updating, but business as usual, no?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No. [shaking head] We're throwing out the entire playbook, we're starting from scratch, we're implementing a brand new system.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good, so, we're on the same page?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No. We're not. Michael, I know exactly how much time and man power are wasted in this branch. This company is getting younger, faster, more efficient. You need to prepare yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We had a foreign exchange student live with us when I was young. And we called him my brother. And that's who I thought he was. Um, then he went home to what is now formerly Yugoslavia, taking all of my blue jeans with him. And I had to spend the entire winter in shorts. That is what Ryan is like. A fake brother who steals your jeans.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: So, how are you?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Awesome. I am dating a lot of guys.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: A lot. Black guys mostly.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Kelly...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What?!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Wait, uh, how do you touch just one of these buttons at a time?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Did you even try?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: If the kid wants to set mine up, I'll let him.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I can't see half of the things. [adjusts glasses]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It's too little. Use the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I want you to tell me that you care about me. That is what I want.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Kelly, I'm your boss now, OK? You can't keep talking to me like I'm your boyfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh big strong man, fancy new whatever. I don't think you ever cared about me.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I never cared about you? Six months ago Karen Filipelli sent me an email. Asked me out. I said no, because I was committed to our relationship.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, I hope you're still committed because I'm pregnant.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [shaking head]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: And guess what buddy, [points at Ryan] I am keeping it.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: OK. OK.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Do you feel prepared to help me raise a baby?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I can... I can't talk about this right now, OK? After work, we'll go out to dinner, we'll talk about it then, OK?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: We have a date!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hello, Dwight. I've been thinking about things and I wanted to know if you would have dinner with me tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll make a reservation. No, no. Let me cook for you. Cauliflower and noodles. Baked potato on the side.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I would prefer a public place. See you after work.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hi, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Is Michael in?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: In his office. You can go right in.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [to Ryan] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Ryan. Ryan. Ryan, Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: So elephant in the room, I have your old job.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, not exactly my job... I had a different title.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh well, excuse me, same office, same responsibilities.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Different salary. [laughs] You'll get there, don't worry.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well... you look great.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Thank you, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Scranton suits you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Best decision I ever made.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You were let go.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You know what? I love the beard. Keep it forever. [goes into Michael's office]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [holds up Blackberry] Hey, what is the actual deal with these things in terms of testicles?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't want to grow weird sperm in case we ever want to have kids.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So, what's Ryan doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I dunno, they're launching a big new business plan. New website, blah blah blah. He's being a real twerp about it, so, it's all about youth, and agility and streamlining and trying to squeeze out the older people.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: He's such a snake.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I hope he's gets hit with an ageism suit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is that... word?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Ageism? Companies they can't discriminate against people due to old age. Like a couple years ago we tried to force out some of the older branch managers with a mandatory retirement age and then Ed Truck, your old boss, threatened us with a lawsuit, so we had to back off.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So older people have just as many rights as younger people?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yes, Michael, they do.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Creed?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Yes, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Everything OK? [Creed has made his hair jet black]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Everything's cool, dude.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I'm thirty. Well, in November I'll be thirty.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Is there another meeting scheduled, I was gonna do the Blackberry tutorial in here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael told us to wait in here. We don't know why.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [notices pictures on the wall] Ohh... man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good, we're all here, we can get started.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Have a seat.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We're not doing this today.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Have a seat. Like everybody else.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: OK. This is...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Still my office, Ryan. [Ryan sits down] Well, there has been a lot of talk about new ideas today. Well, new ideas are fine, but they are also... illegal, because they are a form of ageism. What? Yes, I am right. Did you know that the Age Discrimination and Employment Act of 1967 prohibits employment discrimination based on age with respect to employees 40 years of age or older? I did.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Technically, he's right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, shut up Toby. Look, why do we as a society hate old people so much?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Because they're lame.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, Creed, no they are not. In fact, many cultures revere old people because of their storytelling ability. Like the old lady from Titanic. [points to her picture on the wall] Or the funny things that they can do, like "where's the Beef?" [points to another picture on wall] [Jim raises his hand] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why do you have the Big picture up again? You used that already, when you burned your foot.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Reusing the Ben Kingsley, too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was going to put up some new pictures, but umm, all of the ink in the printer was gone.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh. [man enters conference room]

Quote.Speaker: Robert Dunder
Quote.Text: Michael Scott?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [puts hand up] That is me. Come on in. [They shake hands] Who is this old fart? Did you just stagger off the street? Out of a box or something? Who's this worthless bag of bones? Well, this guy is none other than one of the founders of Dunder Mifflin, Mr. Robert Dunder. Huh? [starts clapping, others join in]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Robert Dunder
Quote.Text: Thank you everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Michael, [gets up] can I talk to you a second?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sure thing. [both go out of conference room] 'Scuse me. [closes door]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We have actual work to do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Fine. Then I will call David Wallace and you can explain to him why you threw the founder of the company out on his ancient butt. [they glare at each other]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bob, how old are you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Eighty-seven years young. And still active. That is great. Did you know, that Bob is still a member of the Board of Dunder Mifflin?

Quote.Speaker: Robert Dunder
Quote.Text: Well, I, I, I haven't been to a board meeting in years. I, I send a proxy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, still sends his own proxy. Good for you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm gonna live for a very long time. My grandma Schrute lived to be 101. My grandpa Manheim is 103, and still puttering around in Argentina. I tried to go visit him once, but my travel visa was protested by the Shoah Foundation.

Quote.Speaker: Robert Dunder
Quote.Text: I started this company in 1949.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Robert Dunder
Quote.Text: Back then, it was an uh, an industrial supplier of metal brackets mostly for, for construction.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, boy.

Quote.Speaker: Robert Dunder
Quote.Text: And then Mifflin, of course he killed himself later... Uh, but I knew Mifflin through the Rotary Club.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Robert Dunder
Quote.Text: And he was, he was [starts laughing] at dinner with Beverly and her husband, wha-what was his name, umm... uhh... Jerry.. Jerry Trupiano from, from South Jersey and he was tall. Both he and Mifflin were tall guys.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Robert Dunder
Quote.Text: And...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's great. Thank you for coming in. [starts ushering him out] Robert Dunder everybody. [clapping] Thank you. That was wonderful. Do you have a ride?

Quote.Speaker: Robert Dunder
Quote.Text: Well I, I, I came here in a cab.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Perfect. [starts closing the door]

Quote.Speaker: Robert Dunder
Quote.Text: Well, cou, could you get me another... [Michael closes door]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Inspirational. What have we learned? Well, we have learned that you can't teach an old dog new tricks, because it's illegal, and you will go to jail. [Pam raises hand]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think that I should help him get home.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, No. Don't help him. He doesn't need help, Pam. [Jim nods head and Pam gets up and leaves to help Robert Dunder, Michael shows Robert thumbs up] What a nice guy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good night guys. [staff leaves the office]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well, today was a fantastic waste of time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I disagree, I think it was very valuable.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Michael, technology helps business OK? You should not resist it, this is the way the world is moving.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I happen to think the old ways of doing business are better. And I can prove it.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ok. I look forward to hearing your ideas. [Michael retreats back to office] [to Kelly] Where do you wanna go?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You know, some place romantic and expensive.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Kelly, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You know what, you're right. I'm feeling kind of nauseous anyway. So, you know skip it. [Ryan hesitates and takes her hand and they exit]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you enjoying your vegetarian noodles?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Very much. How's your meat?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dry. Delicious.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I heard a joke today.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, that's funny.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes, it was.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you enjoying your mineral water?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I can't do this. I can't be with you. Every time I look in your eyes I see Sprinkles' stiff lifeless body.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Then don't look in my eyes. Look right here [points to middle of forehead above the eyes], it's an old sales trick.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. I gave this everything I could.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, please don't do this, monkey.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I will leave your toothbrush on top of your tire tomorrow morning. [gets up and leaves restaurant]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey guys. This is my, uh, girlfriend, Amy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Amy. How ya doing?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [under his breath] Nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [gesturing to the rest of the office] This is everybody else... okay... This is the place... so thanks for the lift.

Quote.Speaker: Amy
Quote.Text: Yeah, sure. I'll, uh, I'll see you tonight, right?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Absolutely. [Toby kisses Amy for an extended period of time, Pam and Jim are shocked]

Quote.Speaker: Amy
Quote.Text: Whoa. Easy tiger.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I just really like you.

Quote.Speaker: Amy
Quote.Text: Okay. Bye guys. Nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Have a great day!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Whoa, Toby. Watch out. You're going to violate your own PDA memo.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I wouldn't want to do that now would I?
